entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 3:35PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Thursday Afternoon Through Saturday... entry.cap:areaDesc: St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.summary: ...Water Levels Rising Again Later This Week And Weekend... Multiple weather fronts will bring several rounds of rain to the Western Brooks Range. entry.cap:areaDesc: Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 6:45AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High River Levels This Week... Rivers draining the Brooks Range, including the Colville River, will remain high this week. More rain late this week could cause water levels to rise this weekend. Water levels may reach bankfull in some locations this weekend, with gravel bars being covered, increased debris in the river, and water up to the brush
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeastern Brooks Range; Northwestern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 3:53AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED WATER LEVELS EXPECTED FOR KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY... There is increasing confidence for a strong frontal system to bring gusty southerly gale force winds to the Kuskokwim Delta coast Thursday into Friday. The resulting higher seas and surf coinciding with high tide could raise water levels 2 to 5 feet
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kuskokwim Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 2:43PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Winds, Rough Surf and Localized High Water... A strong low will bring gusty westerly winds as high as 55 mph beginning tonight and peaking early Wednesday morning. Rough surf and a minor rise in water levels is also expected during this time and may be 1-1.5 feet above the normal high tide line. Winds and water levels will gradually diminish throughout the day.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 5:28PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Sweetwater County through 615 PM MDT... At 527 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Squaw Hollow Boat Ramp On Flaming Gorge, which is also 15 miles northeast of Manila, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail.
